review: Doesn't seem to work very well.  The video is choppy and about once a day it freezes and takes about 30 seconds to register each remote button push.  I have to shut down the whole TV/video/stereo system for a few seconds and reboot.  There is a "reset" button under system tools which works if you can get to it, but when the system is frozen you have no choice but to cut the power and start all over again.
author: J. Caruso

review: This is NOT a streaming type device like Roku so don't expect that you can access and download any apps.  It's fine if you have an older tv that doesn't stream anything but you will ONLY get the FIXED apps provided by Amazon. If you don't have prime membership then you'll have to pay some sort of subscription for movies/tv shows etc. And no, it does not have Vudu.

review: So great, I bought four Fire TV boxes (two for me and one for a daughter).  We have one in our RV and one at home.  It is the perfect RV companion because we don't have to worry about the local channel line up or our finicky BluRay player on the road.  The best feature is the voice search - unbelievably accurate and fast.
